install.name: User Source - LDAP
install.author: Sam Moffatt
install.description: Retrieves users from an LDAP directory

param.name: ldap_blocked
param.label: Map User Blocked
param.description: LDAP Attribute to map blocked users

param.name: ldap_groups
param.label: Map User Groups
param.description: LDAP Attribute to map users groups

param.name: ldap_groupmember
param.label: Map Group Members
param.description: The attribute in LDAP storing the member of a given group. This is used by the group mapping system in reverse.

param.name: groupMap
param.label: Group Map
param.description: Maps LDAP Groups to Joomla! Groups

param.name: reversegroupmembership
param.label: Use reverse group membership
param.description: Look at the group to find if the user is a member instead of looking at the user; use for Apache DS or environments that may not have dynamic attributes

param.name: authenticategroupsearch
param.label: Authenticate Group Search
param.description: Use the connect username and password to login before doing a reverse group search

param.name: recursivegroupmembership
param.label: Use recursive group membership
param.description: Uses the users existing group memberships to recurse up the tree to include its potential parent groups. Useful in Microsoft Active Directory's nested group structure.

param.name: use_iconv
param.label: Use iconv
param.description: iconv is required to convert some fields into UTF-8 that is stored in the database. You will need iconv installed (See System -> System Info -> PHP Info) or this will error

param.name: iconv_from
param.label: Original Encoding (e.g. ISO8859-1)
param.description: This is the encoding used in your LDAP directory.

param.name: iconv_to
param.label: Target Encoding (e.g. your database)
param.description: This is the encoding used in your database server (e.g. MySQL, typically UTF-8)
